conclusion: When the light source moves forward above the objects, the shadows of the objects will change in both location and size.
Shadow A (Glove) will move forward, closer to the glove.
Shadow A (Glove) will get smaller as the light source moves forward.
Shadow B (Typewriter) will move forward, closer to the typewriter.
Shadow B (Typewriter) will get smaller as the light source moves forward.
Shadow C (Crab) will move forward, closer to the crab.
Shadow C (Crab) will get smaller as the light source moves forward.
Shadow D (Peaches) will move forward, closer to the peaches.
Shadow D (Peaches) will get smaller as the light source moves forward.
In summary, all shadows will move closer to their respective objects and decrease in size as the light source moves forward.
